translations.translation: and the Blazing Fire will be displayed for all who can see.
And Hell made visible to him who can see,
and Hell will be brought in sight for anyone to see:
Hell fire will become visible for those who would see it.
And hell will be made visible to all those who can see.
And Hell shall be made apparent for whoever sees.
And the hell shall be made manifest to him who sees
and Hell is advanced for whoever sees,
And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth,
and Hell is there for all to see,
And the Scorch will be made apparent to any one who beholdeth.
and hell is brought into view for those who can see—
And Hell-Fire shall be placed in full view for (all) to see,-
And Hell-fire shall be made apparent in full view for (every) one who sees,
and when Hell is advanced for whoever sees,
And Hell will be displayed to whoever sees.
And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
[79:36] and the Hell-fire, the consuming Fire, is revealed for all to see, for every on-looker (the response to idhā, ‘when’, is [what follows]):
(And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth) to him who is ordained to enter it,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ } أي كُشِفَ غِطاؤُها

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ } أي: ظهرت ولاحت { لِمَن يَرَىٰ } [النازعات: 36] أي: لكل من يتأتى منه الرؤية؛ أي: ظهر أمرها، بحيث لا يخفى على أحد

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ وبُرّزَت الجحيمُ } أي: أظهرت إظهاراً بيناً لا يخفى على أحد { لمن يرى } كائناً مَن كان، فلا تتوقف رؤيتها إلاّ على وجود حاسة البصر، ولا مانع من الرؤية ولا حاجب
 يُروى أنه يُكشف عنها فتلتظي نيرانها كل ذي بصر
